bwwExcerpt: ion-less minutes and with low costs, an existent YouTube fame, a gently progressive sensibility and a youthful target demographic, is as well-suited to this moment as any piece of live entertainment. Robert Hofler, The Wrap : Toby Marlow and Lucy Moss score is immediately hummable in the way that only derivative disco music can be. The often witty book, built around a competition among the six wives of Henry VIII, borrows a lot from "RuPaul s Drag Race" while offering yet another #MeToo story. Those theatrical commonplaces aside, "Six" is a needed antidote to "Anastasia," "Frozen," "Jagged Little Pill," "Wicked" and other pompous shows of female empowerment. Ruth Kinane, Entertainment Weekly : Sitting in a theater packed with fellow fully-vaccinated, mask-wearing Broadway lovers brings a sense of solidarity and camaraderie to the atmosphere, a vibe mirrored on-stage by the cast s girl-group dynamic. Add to that the joy that s always been the DNA of this production, and Six truly is the
